questions.description:
The equilibrium constant of the reaction:
Cu(s) + 2Ag⁺(aq.) → Cu⁺²(aq) + 2Ag(s)
E° = 0.46 Vat 298K is :
Kohlrausch's law states that at :

options.description: Finite dilution, each ion makes definite contribution 	to equivalent conductivity of an electrolyte, whatever be the nature of the other ion of the electrolyte.
Infinite dilution, each ion makes definite contribution to equivalent conductivity of an electrolyte depending on the nature of the other ion of the electrolyte.
Infinite dilution, each ion makes definite contribution to conductance of an electrolyte, wheatever be the nature of the other ion of the electrolyte.
Infinite dilution, each ion makes definite contribution to equivalent conductivity of an electrolyte, whatever be the nature of the other ion of the electrolyte.

questions.description: Al₂O₃ is reduced by electrolysis at low potentials and high currents. If 4.0 × 10⁴ A of current is passed through molten Al₂O₃ for 6 h, what mass of aluminium is produced? (Assume 100% current efficiency, at. mass of Al = 27 g mol¯¹)
The equivalent conductivity of M/32 solution of a weak monobasic acid is 8.0 mho cm2 equl¯¹ and at infinite dilution is 400 mho cm² equl¯¹. The dissociation constant of this acid is :

Given,			
(i) Cu²⁺ + 2e¯ → Cu; E⁰ = 0.337 V
(ii) Cu⁺²+ e¯ → Cu⁺; E⁰ = 0.15 V
Electro potential, E° for the reaction
Cu⁺ + e¯ → Cu will be :

Consider the following relations for emf of an electrochemical cell :
(i) EMF of cell = (Oxidation potential of anode) – (Reduction potential of cathode)
(ii) EMF of cell = (Oxidation potential of anode) + (Reduction potential of cathode)
(iii) EMF of cell = (Reduction potential of anode) + (Reduction potential of cathode)
 (iv) EMF of cell = (Oxidation potential of anode) – (Oxidation potential of cathode) 
Which of the above relations are correct :
An increase in equivalent conductivity of a strong electrolyte with dilution is  mainly due to:

options.description: Increase in ionic mobility of ions.
100% ionisation of electrolyte at normal dilution.
Increase in both i.e. number of ions and ionic mobility of ions.

questions.description: For the reduction of silver ions with copper metals, the standard cell potential was found to be +0.46V at 25°C. The value of standard Gibbs energy △G° will be (F = 96500 C mol¯¹)
Standard electrode potential of three metals X, Y and Z are – 1.2 V, + 0.5 V and – 3.0 V respectively. The reducing power of these metals will be:

Standard electrode potential for Sn⁴⁺ / Sn²⁺ couple is + 0.15 V and that for the Cr³⁺ / Cr couple is – 0.74 V. These two couples in their standard state are connected to make a cell. The cell potential will be :
If the E⁰cell for a given reaction has a negative value, then which of the following gives the correct relationships for the values of  △G⁰ and Keq ?

Standard reduction potentials of the half reactions are given below :
F₂(g) + 2e¯ → 2F¯ (aq) ; E⁰ = + 2.85 V 
Cl₂(g) + 2e¯ → 2Cl¯ (aq) ; E⁰ = + 1.36 V 
Br₂(l) + 2e¯ → 2Br¯ (aq) ; E⁰ = + 1.06 V 
I₂(s) + 2e¯  → 2I¯ (aq) ; E⁰ =  + 0.53 V
The strongest oxidising and reducing agents respectively are :
Molar conductivities (⋀⁰ m) at infinite dilution of NaCl, HCl and CH₃COONa are 126.4, 425.9 and 91.0 S cm² mol¯¹ respectIvely. ⋀⁰ m for CH₃COOH will be:

A hydrogen gas electrode is made by dipping platinum wire in a solution of HCl of pH = 10 and by passing hydrogen gas around the platinum wiere at one atm pressure. The oxidation potential of electrode would be?

At 25⁰C molar conductivity of 0.1 molar aqueous solution of ammonium hydroxide is 9.54 ohm¯¹ cm² mol¯¹ and at infinite dilution its molar conductivity is 238 ohm¯¹ cm²  mol¯¹. The degree or ionisation of ammonium hydroxide at the same concentration and temperature is :
When 0.1 mol MnO₄²¯ is oxidised the quantity of electricity required MnO₄²¯  to MnO₄¯ completely  to  is :
The weight of silver (at.wt. = 108) displaced by a quantity of electricity which displaces 5600 mL of O₂ at STP will be :
A device that converts energy of combustion of fuels like hydrogen and methane, directly into electrical energy is know as :

On the basis of the following E° values, the strongest oxidizing agent is 
[Fe(CN)₆]⁴¯→ [Fe(CN)₆]³¯ + e¯  ; E° = – 0.35 V 
Fe²⁺ → Fe³⁺ + e¯¹  ; E° = – 0.77 V
The pressure of H₂ required to make the potential of H₂-electrode zero in pure water at 298 K is :

The molar conductivity of a 0.5 mol/ dm3 solution of AgNO₃ with electrolytic conductivity of 
5.76 × 10¯³ S cm¯¹ at 298 K is
The number of electrons delivered at the cathode during electrolysis by a current of 1 ampere in 60 seconds is (charge on electron = 1.60 × 10¯¹⁹ C)
During the electrolysis of molten sodium chloride, the time required to produce 0.10 mol of chlorine gas using a current of 3 A is :
Zinc can be coated on iron to produce galvanized iron but the reverse is not possible. It is because

options.description: Zinc has higher negative electrode potential than iron
Zinc has lower melting point than iron
Zinc has lower negative electrode potential than 	iron

questions.description:
In the electrochemical cell :	    
Zn l ZnSO₄ (0.01 M ) ll CuSO₄ (1.0 M) Cu, the emf of this Daniel cell is E₁. When the concentration of ZnSO₄ is changed to 1.0 M and that of CuSO₄ changed to 0.01 M , the emf changes to E₂. From the followings which one is the relationship between E₁ and E₂? (Given, = RT/F 0.059)

Consider the change in oxidation state of Bromine corresponding to different emf values as shown in the diagram below 
BrO₄ → BrO₃ → HBrO → Br₂ →  Br¯		
Then the species undergoing disproportionation is :

For the cell reaction :		
2Fe₃+(aq) + 2I–(aq)  2Fe₂+(aq) + I₂(aq) E¯cell= 0.24 V at 298 K. The rstandard Gibbs energy (△f G¯) of the cell reaction is : 
[Given that Faraday constant F = 96400 C mol¯¹]

Following limiting molar conductivities are given as
 λ⁰M (H₂SO₄) = x S cm² mol¯¹
 λ⁰M (K₂SO₄) = y S cm² mol¯¹
 λ⁰M (CH₂COOK) = z S cm² mol¯¹
 λ⁰M (in S cm₂ mol¯¹) for CH₃COOH will be
On electrolysis of dil. sulphuric acid using Platinum (Pt) electrode, the product obtained at anode will be

The number of Faradays(F) required to produce 20 g of calcium from molten CaCl₂ 
(Atomic mass of Ca = 40 g mol¯¹) is :

The molar conductance of NaCl, HCl and CH₃COONa at infinite dilution are 126.45, 426.16 and 91.0 S cm₂ mol¯¹ respectively. The molar conductance of CH₃COOH at infinite dilution is. Choose the right option for your answer :

The molar conductivity of 0.007 M acetic acid is 
20 S cm² mol¯¹. What is the dissociation constant of acetic acid ? Choose the correct option :
⋀⁰H = 350 S cm² mol¯¹	
⋀⁰CH₃COO¯= 50 S cm² mol¯¹

At 298 K, the standard electrode potentials of Cu²⁺/Cu, Zn²⁺/Zn, Fe²⁺/ Fe and Ag+ / Ag are 0.34 V, –0.76 V, –0.44 V and 0.80 V, respectively.On the basis of standard electrode potential, predict which of the following reaction can not occur ?
The conductivity of centimolar solution of KCl at 25ºC is 0.0210 ohm¯¹ cm¯¹ and the resistance of the cell containing the solution at 25ºC is 60 ohm. The value of cell constant is -

Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R :
Assertion (A) : In equation △rG = – nFEcell, value of △rG depends on n.
Reasons (R) : Ecell is an intensive property and △rG is an extensive property.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
A is true but R is false.
A is false but R is true.
Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.

questions.description:
Given below are half cell reactions :
MnO₄¯ + 8H⁺ + 5e¯ → Mn²⁺ + 4H₂O,
E⁰ Mn²⁺/MnO₄¯ = – 1.510V
1/2O₂ + 2H⁺ + 2e¯ → H₂O,
E⁰O₂/H₂O = + 1.223 V
Will the permanganate ion, MnO₄¯ liberate O₂ from water in the presence of an acid ?
